Posts.Content: Dec 23, 2016 11:02AM - edited Dec 23, 2016 11:06AM by 2yorkies I just finished my fifth radiation tx today. They give me 8 zaps and I always know when they do my axilla. It isn't pain, just awareness like I can feel it penetrating my skin. I had a ALND and feeling is starting to return! I asked the radiation techs if it was possible that I could feel the rads. They looked at me like I was crazy, but I am not!ðŸ˜²

Posts.Content: Jan 11, 2017 11:25AM 2yorkies wrote: Thanks to everyone who posted pictures! It gives me hope. I am 14 weeks PFC and have about an inch of hair sticking out everywhere! I have always colored my hair, so it grew back gray and very white in front. I was wondering what coloring options everyone chose. Have been looking at organic hair color, but not sure how effective it is. I just want to look in the mirror and see me, not the cancer girl of the past 7 months!

Posts.Title: Small cell breast cancer 2yorkies 2yorkies

Posts.Content: 2yorkies wrote: Has anyone else been diagnosed with small cell breast cancer? I was diagnosed 6/1/16, and my cancer treatment team has only treated two other cases of this rarity! I completed 6 rounds of chemo with carboplatin and vp16. Now waiting for surgery, to be followed by radiation for 6 weeks. Only getting one month break between each tx due to aggressiveness of this triple negative cancer. Dx 6/1/2016, Left, 1cm, Stage IIA, Grade 3, 0/15 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2- Chemotherapy 6/13/2016 Carboplatin (Paraplatin) Surgery 11/1/2016 Lymph node removal: Left; Mastectomy: Left, Right; Prophylactic mastectomy: Right; Reconstruction (left): Tissue expander placement; Reconstruction (right): Tissue expander placement Radiation Therapy 12/1/2016 Whole-breast: Breast, Lymph nodes Log in to post a reply
